WRITING.TEXT: Yeah debbie said in her ponderosa that she didn't know who flipped but if she found out she'd never vote for them. Sarah could have still gotten her vote had she not revealed that.

WRITING.TITLE: With __ in the alliance, was __ a smart move?
WRITING.TEXT: With Sarah in their alliance, was it a smart move for the 6 to vote out Zeke? They all knew that after doing this all it would take would be one person to flip to no longer have majority, and Sarah has been flipping back and forth this whole time. So is it smart at all to position yourself in an alliance of 5, where only one person needs to flip to screw you over, and one person has proven themselves very comfortable with flipping?

I think storywise the anime is great, it's been doing a great job of giving each character a lot of focus. I think I heard somewhere or got the sense from someone talking about the manga back when season 1 finished that the next arc wouldn't be as focused on Eren/Mikasa/Armin, and I was disappointed to hear that because it didn't sound like the story was going to go in an interesting direction, but I've actually really been enjoying it.
I think I was expecting going into this season for it to be something like Lost where we really didn't get any answers and the show just kept getting more bizarre and mysterious, so I was surprised in the premiere when the wall-titan was directly addressed by the characters as being something weird in the world. I don't know why I wasn't expecting that, but I think in that vein there are a lot of things that feel more concrete and real than I was expecting and so I'm really happy about that.
My only gripe with the anime is the actual animation. It's beautiful, yes, but there are a lot of times where no characters in the background are moving or there are just complete still shots. I get that they didn't have the biggest budget, it just ruins immersion a little bit.
Dang, the manga is 50 chapters past what the show is at??
If it is I'm gonna be annoyed because I'm too dumb or slow to make the connection between people looking just like their titan forms but someone pointed that out on here last week.
Based on the opening sequence (where it shows Eren in titan form fighting the armored titan) I assumed it would be the Armored Titan.
Eh...Eren does that yes but it seems like the more experienced and self-aware shifters don't do it like that. Ymir cut herself instead of biting herself and Annie made people shoot her.
people say this every episode lol. It's because 5 of the 24 minutes is taken up by opening credits/ending credits/preview

From what we've seen though, it doesn't seem like all shifters are a part of the same group. There are anti-human shifters or special titans like the Armored Titan, Colossal Titan, and Beast Titan (although I guess those three aren't confirmed to be shifters but it seems implied to me) and then there are pro-human shifters like Eren and Ymir. It seems to me like maybe some people were turned into shifters to fight titans while others were turned into shifters to fight humans. Idk though.
To be fair, when Eren had his arms and legs bitten off he turned into a titan. Ymir had to leg and arm ripped off and stomach torn open while she was inside her titan form.

This comment sounds like a fucking robot wrote it. Saying "just find someone else" fails completely to take into account human emotion and the fact that we can't control it. It's not like people choose to like someone as more than a friend and set themselves up for disappointment when the feeling isn't requited.

People always complain about this on reddit but it's based on a misunderstanding of what guys mean when they say they are friendzoned. Being friendzoned isn't viewing women as sexual property and being disappointed when they don't put out. It's about unrequited feelings. Wanting to be more than friends with someone and having them only want to be friends is painful whether you're a woman or man or both, it's not about sex at all.

I love how some girls make it out like looking where they are sitting is a harder task than putting down a seat that you're not even going to use--when you already had to put it up in the first place.

Yes, but that was in Redemption Island, hence why I said "I feel like a jury in a season called Game Changers". The cast in RI was full of goats who were probably big fans of Rob. This jury is going to be filled with gameplayers who have a higher threshold to earn the win.
Yes but them saying they hate it is still a form of criticism, what I interpreted the title of the thread to mean was "hate" as in baseless hate for the sake of hating something.
Petition to stop labelling any sort of criticism as "hate".
